pageContent:
Krishna Gurram 
Certified Salesforce Consultant 
Trailblazer: https://trailblazer.me/id/krishnasfconsultant  
LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/krishna-kg/ 
Email: krishnagurram.sfo@gmail.com 
Phone: 510 458-9334 
 
Overview 
 
Over 10+ years of information technology industry experience in the Salesforce.com CRM Platform 
(Service, Sales, Marketing, Community/Experience Cloud). Additionally, well versed in various stages of the 
Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) including Business analysis, Requirements gathering, Application 
development, Deployment, and maintenance of web-based and portal-based object-oriented enterprise 
applications. 
 
Currently holds Salesforce Admin, Advanced Admin, Business Analyst, Service Cloud Consultant, 
Community/Digital Experience Cloud Consultant, Platform app builder certifications along with Developer

Currently holds Salesforce Admin, Advanced Admin, Business Analyst, Service Cloud Consultant, 
Community/Digital Experience Cloud Consultant, Platform app builder certifications along with Developer 
certification with significant experience in developing client-specific solutions on the force.com platform 
using Workflow, Process builders, Flows, Approval process, Apex classes and triggers, Visual Force, 
Lightning Pages, Lightning Components, Force.com IDE, SOQL, and SOSL. This experience also includes 
designing custom objects, custom fields, role-based page layouts, custom tabs, custom reports, report 
folders, report extractions to various formats, design of Visualforce Pages, Snapshots and Dashboards.

Professional Experience 
 
 Client: California Public Employees’ Retirement System (CalPERS) 
 
Project:  Various Investment Office Salesforce Projects 
Role:  Salesforce Developer - Contractor through SohanIT Inc 
Location:  Sacramento, CA Dates:  
April 2018 – Present 
 
Project Details: CalPERS is the largest public employee pension in the US and has over $300B invested in a 
diversified portfolio for the benefit of its members. Engaged as a member of a small team to develop and

diversified portfolio for the benefit of its members. Engaged as a member of a small team to develop and 
maintain applications for the CalPERS Investment Office, in partnership with their Technology 
Management Unit (TMU). 
 
 
 Salesforce and web developer embedded with CalPERS Investment Office (INVO) to produce 
customized Salesforce applications.
 Helped build an Agile DevOps workflow using Atlassian CD/CD to improve the efficiency and quality of 
the Salesforce development process; introduced version control and Scrum methodologies to a multi-
member engineering team.
 Implemented Big objects, cross Object Formula Fields, Lookups and Master-Details etc.
 Designed an Operating Event Web-Form using Lightning components.
 Implemented scalable and reusable custom Lightning components and Web Components.

application workflow.

platform developed for the Investment Office.
 Integrated the Web Form records from Salesforce to RSA Archer, a third-party application in use at 
CalPERS - used shell script response to integrate Salesforce and RSA with Json output.

 Implementation of Marketing cloud connector setup with Sales Cloud.
 Maintain/Update Community pages and support community cloud users.
 Migration of Aura enabled Lightning component bundle to Lightning Web Component (LWC).

Production environment.

 Refactored Salesforce Change Control Request application widely used for requesting release

 Designed and implemented HR Data Salesforce application that integrated with PeopleSoft to 
automate the tracking of staff changes, which also eliminated the need purchase an additional ETL 
software tool.

software tool.

Client: State of Georgia Eligibility Systems  
 
Project: Integrated Eligibility Systems (IES)

Builder from Winter ’23 and Summer ’23.


Client: State of Georgia Eligibility Systems  
 
Project: Integrated Eligibility Systems (IES) 
Role:  Salesforce Developer/Consultant - Contractor through Noblesoft Solutions. 
Location: Atlanta, GA 
Dates: November 2016 – April 2018

Project Details: Georgia Integrated Eligibility Systems (IES) is a one-stop system that includes Medicaid, Peach 
Care for Kids, TANF, Food Stamps (SNAP), LIHEAP, P4HB, WIC and Childcare and Parent Services. It includes a 
best-in-class self-service portal giving clients easy to use, real-time, self-service for applications and renewals 
which helps to minimize caseworker intervention, reduces workload and improves overall customer service. 
It is a fully populated portal with business rules and centralized Enterprise Master Person Index (EMPI), 
which provides a single view of the client and integrated eligibility decisions, while being compliant with state 
and federal policies. Main objective was to design and implement the application to provide services and 
support that promote the well-being of the people of the State of Georgia. 

 Developed batch interfaces and processes to integrate Salesforce.com with external systems.

support that promote the well-being of the people of the State of Georgia.

Components and Visualforce Pages.

components on record detail pages and edit pages.
 Created workflow rules and defined related tasks. Worked on configure/price/quote (CPQ) to

Opportunities, Products, Opportunity Line Items, Leads, Campaigns, Reports and Dashboards.
 Involved in Data load operations using Force.com Apex Data Loader.

develop custom business logic.

CIT Bank 
 
Project: Salesforce Migration project 
Role:  Salesforce Consultant - Admin/Developer 
Location:  Jersey City - NJ 
Dates:  December 2015 – October 2016

Project Details:  Migration of Salesforce Classic Experience to Salesforce Lightning Experience for this financial 
holding company which has more than $30 billion of deposits and more than $40 billion of assets. 
 
Responsibilities: 

 Key person in the process of migration from Salesforce Classic Experience to Salesforce Lightning 
Experience. 
 Customized UI using JavaScript controllers, Angular JS, HTML, Salesforce UI Components to achieve 
the best front-end experience. 
 Worked independently to meet proposed deadlines; engaged supervisor as needed. 
 Hands on experience on CRM demand tools in the process of de-duplication of Account. 
 Interacted with various business stakeholders/product owners to gather and document the 
requirements. Implemented the requirements on Salesforce.com platform.  
 Administrated and monitored the company’s Salesforce CRM application. Created the workflows for 
automated lead routing, lead escalation and email alert.

 Administrated and monitored the company’s Salesforce CRM application. Created the workflows for 
automated lead routing, lead escalation and email alert. 
 Created Profiles, Roles based on Organization role hierarchy and implemented Record-Level and 
Field-Level security and configured their sharing settings. 
 Involved in gathering customer requirements from business user teams spread over the Sales, 
Marketing and Customer service. 
 Involved in creating gap analysis document, clearly identifying the data, business process and 
workflows of the organization with respect to salesforce.com implementation. 
 Developed and customizing salesforce.com application based on the user needs. 
 Supported integration with third party applications and legacy systems.  
 Enhanced Salesforce functionality through Apex code and Triggers as needed. 
 Used logging and tracking to identify system problems through Console Directory Methods using 
assertion techniques.

 Enhanced Salesforce functionality through Apex code and Triggers as needed. 
 Used logging and tracking to identify system problems through Console Directory Methods using 
assertion techniques. 
 Debugged custom Lightning components using Apex, Visualforce, and controllers for customized UI of 
application workflow. 
 Customized user Roles, Role hierarchies, Profiles and Sharing settings to ensure that the protected 
data is available only to the authorized users of the respective organization. 
 Customized Tabs for different business users’ groups and business centers.
